title: US and UK Airstrikes Slow Iran From Supplying Weapons to Houthis, Officials Say
description: Iran isn’t yet restocking Houthi rebels with weapons by sea after the US and UK air strikes in Yemen last week, Western officials said, signaling cautious optimism that the military action had some success in disrupting the supply of arms to the group.

title: These Are the 12 Friends Taiwan Has Left in the World
description: Taiwan has lost another diplomatic ally, with the 12 friends it has left accounting for just 0.17% of the global economy and less than 0.5% of the world’s population.

title: Ukraine’s Zelenskiy Meets With Polish Counterpart Duda in Davos
description: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskiy met with his Polish counterpart Andrzej Duda in Davos, Switzerland, on Tuesday, following a rift between the neighboring nations last year.

title: Hunter Biden Prosecutor Argues US Gun Charges Should Proceed
description: Prosecuting Hunter Biden for firearm-related offenses is justified and should be allowed to continue, a Justice Department special counsel argued.

title: Supreme Court Case About Herring Has Bigger Implications
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Supreme Court correspondent Greg Stohr looks at two cases in front of the justices with major implications. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Susquehanna Founder Gives Record $6 Million to Greg Abbott
description: Jeff Yass, the founder of market-making firm Susquehanna International Group, donated $6 million to Greg Abbott’s campaign as the Texas governor’s national profile grows following his aggressive approach to the border, migrants and education.

title: China Premier Li Meets Dimon, Business Chiefs at Davos Forum
description: President Xi Jinping’s chief lieutenant gathered Tuesday with the heads of JPMorgan Chase & Co., Intel Corp. and other top global firms at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, in Beijing’s latest appeal to foreign investors.

title: NYC Mayor Reverses Cuts to Police Hiring, Trash Pickup in Budget
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams reversed many of his previously announced cuts to services including police hiring and trash collection in a $109.4 billion preliminary budget he unveiled on Tuesday.

title: One Woman Holds Sway In Indonesia’s All-Men Presidential Race
description: The all-male Indonesian presidential race in February to decide the next leader of Southeast Asia’s largest economy could well be in the hands of a woman.

title: France’s Macron Strikes Conservative Stance in Bid to Counter Far Right
description: President Emmanuel Macron laid out a strikingly conservative vision for France on Tuesday as he seeks to revive support for his government and counter the rise of the far right.

title: With Crime Rates Rising in Chile, This TV Channel Seeks Ban on Mexican Superstar
description: The board of a major Chilean TV channel wants to ban popular Mexican singer Peso Pluma from one of the biggest music festivals in the region for inciting crime.

title: Ex-Alberta Premier Rachel Notley Is Stepping Away From Politics
description: Rachel Notley, who governed the oil-rich Canadian province of Alberta for four years, is stepping down as the leader of the opposition New Democratic Party.

title: Hochul Budget Includes $45 Million for Interborough Light Rail
description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul wants to allocate funds to begin engineering work on two major transit expansion projects in New York City that would increase rail service for nearly 400,000 daily riders.

title: DeSantis, Haley Face New Primary in Doubt After Trump’s Iowa Win
description: Ron DeSantis did just enough in the Iowa caucuses to keep alive his argument that he’s the most formidable Republican challenger to Donald Trump for the party’s nomination.

title: EU Moves Forward With Plans for New Red Sea Naval Operation
description: The European Union agreed to move ahead with plans to establish a new naval operation in the Red Sea to protect commercial shipping as the US conducted new airstrikes against Houthi missile sites in Yemen.

title: America’s Farmers Renew Trump Support Despite Trade War Fears
description: If American farmers have their way, Donald Trump will be president again. That’s despite concerns he could restart a trade war with China, the world’s largest buyer of US agricultural products.

title: Biden Calls In Congressional Leaders for Meeting on Ukraine Aid
description: President Joe Biden will meet Wednesday at the White House with House Speaker Mike Johnson, Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer and other congressional leaders to discuss billions in fresh aid for Ukraine that has stalled on Capitol Hill.

title: Sunak Suffers Blow as Anderson Quits, Tory Rebels Show Strength
description: Rishi Sunak suffered a major setback as Lee Anderson, who was appointed as deputy chairman of the governing Conservative Party to boost its support in key seats ahead of a general election, resigned in protest after the prime minister refused to harden his flagship anti-immigration bill.

title: How Donald Trump’s Candidacy Tests the US Constitution
description: Like no one before him, Donald Trump is at once a former president, a leading candidate to be nominated for the presidency again, and a criminal defendant. He faces 91 felony charges in four separate cases for conduct before, during and after his presidency, including conspiring to defraud the US in his efforts to overturn his 2020 election loss, mishandling classified documents and falsifying business records to cover up hush money to an adult film actress. This unprecedented situation raises q

title: California Lawmakers Eye More Than $100 Billion of Borrowing
description: California is on the verge of a potential borrowing boom as Democratic state lawmakers draft more than $100 billion of municipal-bond proposals to fill funding gaps for several key legislative priorities.

title: US Business, Child Tax-Break Bill Faces Hurdles in Congress
description: US businesses eager for a tax deal announced by two powerful US lawmakers on Tuesday can’t yet bank on the corporate breaks.

title: EU, China Raise EV and Liquor Probes During a Meeting in Davos
description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and Chinese Premier Li Qiang raised their respective electric vehicle and liquor investigations during a meeting in Davos Tuesday, underscoring concern that the new probes risk triggering a broader trade conflict.

title: US Will Stay in NATO Despite Trump, Alliance Chief Says
description: The US won’t quit NATO regardless of the outcome of this year’s elections and despite threats by Donald Trump to exit the military alliance, according to the organization’s chief.

title: US Lawmakers Near Taiwan Tax Deal, Risking Anger From China
description: US lawmakers unveiled a proposal that would eliminate so-called double taxation of Taiwanese workers and firms in America, a step toward a major priority for Taipei and Washington that risks angering Beijing.

title: NY Congestion Pricing Plan Violates US Constitution, NJ Governor Says
description: New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy is again pushing back on New York’s plan to charge motorists driving into Manhattan’s central business district, saying it violates the US Constitution as the new toll discriminates against New Jersey residents.

title: Return of Trump to Power Would Be Difficult for Canada, Trudeau Says
description: If Donald Trump returns for a second term as US President, it would mark a step back for the country and require Canada to take a careful approach to relations with its most important trading partner, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said.

title: Iraq Prime Minister Hits Out at Iran Over Deadly Missile Attacks
description: Iraq criticized a deadly Iranian attack on what the Islamic Republic said was an Israeli spy base on Iraqi soil, fuelling further concerns of a widening conflict across the Middle East.

title: US Struck Houthi Missile Sites in Yemen, an Official Says
description: The US hit four Houthi missile sites in Yemen in a preemptive strike on Monday, an American official said.

title: Hutchinson Exits, Leaving Republican Field With No Trump Critics
description: Former Arkansas Governor Asa Hutchinson suspended his longshot presidential campaign, marking the departure of one of the last old-guard Republican candidates in a party now dominated by former President Donald Trump and his supporters.

title: Swiss Finance Minister Backs Giving Regulator Powers to Fine
description: Finance Minister Karin Keller-Sutter said she’d support giving the Swiss financial regulator the power to fine banks, a step that would bring the country into line with other major financial centers.

title: Zelenskiy Targets ‘Predator’ Putin in Davos Pitch for Kyiv Aid
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy condemned Vladimir Putin as a “predator” and told an audience of global finance and political leaders that aid to Ukraine is worth the investment.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Apple’s Request for Epic App Store Review
description: The US Supreme Court in Washington, DC Photographer: Kent Nishimura/Bloomberg

title: Chile’s Plan to Revamp Privately-Run Pensions Clears a First Hurdle in Congress
description: Chilean President Gabriel Boric’s plan to revamp the country’s privately-run pension system, created in the 80s during the dictatorship of Augusto Pinochet, cleared one of its first hurdles in Congress this week.

title: Biden Urged to Use Obscure Law to Thwart Pacific Northwest Pipeline Expansion
description: Environmentalists are urging the White House to use an obscure legal tool to thwart TC Energy Corp.’s planned expansion of a natural gas pipeline in the Pacific Northwest that they say would stoke climate change.

title: Senator Menendez and His Wife Seek Separate Trials on Bribery Charges
description: US Senator Bob Menendez and his wife, indicted together on bribery charges, have each asked a judge for separate trials.

title: Zuma’s Popularity Threatens ANC’s Majority Hopes, SRF Says
description: The popularity of former South African President Jacob Zuma poses a threat to the ruling African National Congress’s hopes of retaining its majority in this year’s election, the Social Research Foundation said.

title: Greek Ship Hit by Missile as Red Sea Vessel Attacks Intensify
description: A commodity-carrying ship was hit by a missile in the Red Sea, a fresh sign of intensifying attacks on merchant vessels in a waterway that key industry groups are cautioning remains too dangerous for navigation.

title: Two-State Solution Needed to Finance Rebuilding Gaza, Qatar Says
description: Financial aid to rebuild Gaza will be hard to attract unless the key issue of a two-state solution for the Palestinians and Israelis is properly addressed, Qatar’s prime minister said.

title: Davos Elite See the Glass Half Full on the Global Economy
description: Confidence in the resilience of the global economy is cheering up the Davos crowd against a backdrop of war and prospective political upheaval in the year ahead.

title: Goldman Client Survey Shows Geopolitics Is Biggest Risk in 2024
description: Geopolitics poses by far the biggest risk to markets and the global economy this year, with inflation no longer viewed as such a major threat, according to a client survey by Goldman Sachs Group Inc.

title: Russian Crude Flows Defy Red Sea Chaos to Exceed OPEC+ Target
description: Shipments hit 3.43 million barrels a day in the four weeks to Jan. 14

title: On The Horizon: Fujitsu Hearing Prompts Contracts Scrutiny
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Fujitsu Signals It Will Pay Towards Compensation in Post Office Scandal
description: An executive at Fujitsu Ltd., the Japanese IT company embroiled in the UK’s Post Office scandal, said the company has a “moral responsibility” to contribute to redress for sub-postmasters.

title: Ukraine to Receive ‘Thousands’ of Drones as Latvia Coaxes Allies
description: Latvia’s defense chief said the Baltic nation is making progress in assembling a coalition of almost 20 countries to arm Ukrainian forces with “thousands” of new unmanned aerial vehicles.

title: Trump’s Next Trial Kicks Off One Day After Iowa Victory
description: Fresh off his victory in the Iowa Republican caucuses, Donald Trump is set to face a New York jury this week in the next high-stakes trial of his crowded legal calendar  — a defamation lawsuit by writer E. Jean Carroll, who claims he raped her in the 1990s.

title: This Time the World Is Prepared for Trump 2.0
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: China GDP Grew Around 5.2% in 2023, Premier Li Says at Davos
description: China’s economy grew around 5.2% in 2023, surpassing the government’s official growth target for the year without relying on “massive stimulus,” Chinese Premier Li Qiang said in Davos.

title: Israel War Budget Approval Exposes Rifts, Leaves Markets on Edge
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s cabinet approved a revised state budget for 2024 that became bogged down in political wrangling and unnerved investors worried about the government’s fiscal path during the war against Hamas.

title: <!--StartFragment-->Trump Wins Big in Iowa With DeSantis a Distant Runner-Up <!--EndFragment-->
description: A special episode of the Big Take DC podcast unpacks the results of the first contest in the race for the Republican nomination.

title: Dimon Tells Zelenskiy ‘God Bless You’ in Davos Face-to-Face
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy met some of the biggest names in global finance as he seeks to bolster wavering support for his country’s fight against Russia.

title: Iowa Leaves No Doubt for Trump, Plenty for DeSantis and Haley
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. In this special edition, Bloomberg Businessweek columnist Joshua Green assesses the outcome of the Iowa caucuses. The regular newsletter will return this afternoon. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Taiwan’s Investment Into China Plunges to Lowest in Two Decades
description: Taiwanese firms slashed investment into China last year to the lowest since 2001, a sign the companies are moving to protect themselves as tech disputes between Washington and Beijing escalate.

title: EU Progress on Poland Funds Possible Soon, Dombrovskis Says
description: The European Union is coming closer to unblocking access to some of the €60 billion ($65.7 billion) in stalled funding for Poland despite a political standoff, Commission Vice President Valdis Dombrovskis said.

title: Egyptian Overseas Cash Withdrawals Banned by Some Banks Amid FX Crunch
description: At least five Egyptian banks imposed new limits on overseas cash withdrawals and spending as the North African nation wrestles with its worst foreign currency crunch in decades.

title: Davos Live: Zelenskiy to Meet With Dimon in Hunt for Cash
description: Donald Trump’s resounding victory in Monday’s Iowa caucuses and the prospect of him returning to the White House will be the talk of the town at the World Economic Forum in Davos today.

title: Trump Trounces Republican Rivals, Advances Toward Biden Rematch
description: Donald Trump tightened his grip on the Republican presidential nomination after Iowa voters delivered him a victory in Monday’s caucuses and moved him one step closer to returning to the White House.

title: A Wary World Braces for Trump’s Return to the White House
description: Security, trade and climate concerns are uppermost for many US allies. Yet others are more comfortable with the former president’s transactional approach.

title: Ships Keep Running Red Sea Gauntlet After US Warnings
description: Huge numbers of merchant ships have continued to navigate the southern Red Sea since warnings by western navies to stay away from the crucial trade route to avoid attack by Houthi militants.

title: Labour Must Secure Historic Election Swing to Win UK Majority
description: The UK’s Labour Party needs to win a historic 12.7 percentage point swing from the governing Conservatives if it’s to secure power in a general election expected later this year, according to new research that lays bare the scale of the task facing opposition leader Keir Starmer.

title: China Rebukes Singapore for Congratulating New Taiwan Leader
description: Beijing has reminded Singapore of its “one-China” position on Taiwan in a rare show of public disapproval after the city-state congratulated Vice President Lai Ching-te and the ruling Democratic Progressive Party for its election win.

title: Ramaswamy Leaves 2024 Race, Throws Support Behind Trump
description: Vivek Ramaswamy, a political novice who gained attention for his outspoken debate performances, ended his long-shot presidential bid after a weak showing in the Iowa caucuses and threw his support behind frontrunner Donald Trump.

title: China Unveils Plan for Massive ‘Silver Economy’ to Serve Elderly
description: China rolled out a plan for a so-called “silver economy” estimated to be worth trillions of dollars, catering to a rapidly-aging population needing services ranging from meal delivery to nursing homes and entertainment options.

title: Xi Urged Party to Win Taiwan Support in Newly Released Speech
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping urged the ruling Communist Party to do a better job winning the hearts of the Taiwanese people, in an old speech that was published this week following the island’s election of a US-friendly president.

title: Australia Signs Missile Manufacturing Pact With Lockheed Martin
description: Australia has unveiled plans to produce its first locally-made missiles as early as next year under a A$37 million ($24.5 million) contract with American munitions giant Lockheed Martin Corp.

title: Trump Cruises to Iowa Caucus Victory Shortly After Voting Begins
description: Former President Donald Trump cruised to victory in the Iowa caucus, warding off a late challenge from rivals Ron DeSantis and Nikki Haley and cementing his status as the clear Republican frontrunner in the race.

title: Iran Strikes Targets in Iraq Over Soleimani Memorial Attack
description: Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps launched missiles at targets in northern Iraq in what it described as retaliation for terrorist attacks this month that killed almost 100 people near the burial site of General Qassem Soleimani.

title: North Korea Ends Agencies for Reunification to Pressure Seoul
description: North Korean Leader Kim Jong Un called South Korea the most hostile country toward Pyongyang as his government abolished agencies dedicated to reunification, setting the stage for fresh tensions on the heavily militarized peninsula.
